keyword: how many calories are in uranium
title: How Many Calories Are in Uranium?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in uranium—spoiler: zero, as it's a toxic metal, not food. Get full nutrition breakdown, warnings, and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Uranium?
assumptions: Pure uranium element (e.g., U-238 isotope); not a food item, measured hypothetically per 100 g for comparison; no preparation as it's inedible.
disclaimer: Uranium is radioactive and highly toxic—do not ingest or handle without expertise. Values are zero as it's not nutritious; consult professionals for any real analysis.

quick_answer.text: Uranium contains 0 calories since it's a metallic element, not a consumable food.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison, though irrelevant for non-food items.

faqs.q: How many calories are in uranium?
faqs.a: Zero calories—uranium is not food and provides no nutritional energy.

faqs.q: Is uranium safe to eat for calories?
faqs.a: No, it's highly toxic and radioactive; ingestion can cause severe health issues or death.
None—0 g carbs, protein, fat, or any macros; it's a heavy metal element.

faqs.q: Why does uranium have no calories?
faqs.a: Calories measure chemical energy from food metabolism; uranium doesn't metabolize that way.

faqs.q: Can uranium be used in nutrition?
faqs.a: Absolutely not—it's used in nuclear applications, not diet; seek professional advice for food queries.
